summary:
• Beloved Australian actress and Neighbours star Janet Andrewartha has passed away.
• Details of her death are currently unavailable
• No further information is available on the circumstances surrounding her passing.

• Canada's top court has ruled that the government owes First Nations compensation for treaty breaches.
• This landmark decision affirms the rights of Indigenous peoples to self-determination and redress for historical injustices.
• The ruling paves the way for further discussions and negotiations between the federal government and First Nations over treaty obligations.

• A boat carrying passengers has capsized in Ethiopia's Lake Tana, resulting in a fatal accident.
• At least 12 people have died in the incident and several others are injured or missing.
• The exact circumstances surrounding the disaster are still being investigated.

• France's high-speed train network has been repaired after a series of arson attacks.
• Despite some grumbles, the Olympic spirit is alive in Paris despite challenges during the Games.
• The Olympic event in Paris drew an A-list celebrity crowd, with Simone Biles making an appearance.

• US Vice President Kamala Harris's approval ratings have declined in India.
• The Indian public's enthusiasm for her has cooled down due to various factors including COVID-19 response and diplomatic issues.
• Harris's popularity among Indians, which once saw her as a role model, is no longer the same.

• Notable Irish author passes away
• Cause of death is not specified in this report 
• (no additional details provided about Edna O'Brien's passing, only her age at time of death)

• Israelis face a high risk of another war with various groups due to ongoing tensions and rocket attacks.
• Israeli airstrikes have targeted Lebanon after a rocket strike, sparking fears of an all-out conflict.
• There have been multiple attacks in Gaza and the Golan Heights that killed over 40 people, many of them children.

• Tensions between Hezbollah and Israel are escalating, raising concerns of a potential large-scale conflict.
• Hezbollah, a Lebanese Shia Islamist political party and military organization, has been involved in previous battles with Israel, but the situation now appears more volatile than ever.
• The potential war could have severe consequences for Lebanon's already fragile economy and infrastructure.

• Mexican authorities were not informed about the arrest of top cartel leaders until after they had been taken into US custody.
• This lack of communication meant that Mexico was unable to take advantage of the opportunity to capture or dismantle the remaining members of these cartels.
• The situation has raised questions about the cooperation and coordination between US and Mexican law enforcement agencies.

• Many Norwegians feel guilty about their country's colonial past.
• Not everyone in Norway shares these feelings of guilt.
• Guilt over historical actions is a complex issue within Norwegian society.

• South Sudan's Olympic team suffered an embarrassment as the wrong national anthem was played before one of their matches.
• The mix-up occurred during the 2023 World University Games, where a South Sudanese athlete competed in shooting events.
• The incorrect national anthem was reportedly used for multiple countries, sparking confusion among participants.

• A massive California wildfire is consuming 5,000 acres per hour.
• The US and Japan are strengthening their military alliance with new cooperation plans.
• Comparisons between Trump and Biden's immigration policies are highlighted in 12 charts.

Here are three key points about Ukraine:

• US and European countries have provided drones to support Ukraine's military efforts.
• F-16 fighter jets have been delivered to Ukraine, but their impact on the conflict remains uncertain.
• The use of advanced technology in Ukraine suggests a shift towards more hybrid warfare approaches.

• Opposition leader appears to have won Venezuelan presidential election.
• Election results show a significant lead for the opposition candidate over President Maduro.
• Exit polls suggest a wide margin of victory for the opposition, although official results have not been released.
